intro: Anapalina pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful anapalina, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
